adjective.description: Relating to Tuscany, its inhabitants, or the form of Italian spoken there, which is the standard variety taught to foreign learners.
Relating to or denoting a classical order of architecture resembling the Doric but lacking all ornamentation.

noun.description: A native or inhabitant of Tuscany.
The form of Italian spoken in Tuscany.

origin: Late Middle English (as a noun denoting an Etruscan): via French from Latin Tuscanus, from Tuscus an Etruscan.
